content:
# After harvesting, my inventory now contains:
# - 10 coal
# - 14 iron ore
# - 2 iron plates
# - 1 copper plate
# - 1 copper cable
# - 1 iron gear wheel
# - 1 electronic circuit

# With sufficient resources gathered, I will now proceed to use the original stone furnace for smelting.
# First, I will insert coal into the original stone furnace to provide it with fuel.

insert_item(Prototype.Coal, target=old_furnace_entity, quantity=5)  # Insert 5 coal into the original furnace.

# Next, I will insert 1 iron ore into the original furnace to begin the smelting process.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, target=old_furnace_entity, quantity=1)  # Insert 1 iron ore.

# Now, I will wait for the smelting process to complete.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait.
    current_inventory = inspect_inventory(old_furnace_entity)
    if current_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 1:  # Wait until I have at least 1 iron plate.
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout for iron ore in the original furnace - please check resources.")

# Once the smelting is complete, I'll extract the iron plate from the original stone furnace.
extracted_iron_plate = extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, position=old_furnace_entity.position, quantity=1)

# Now, attempt to craft the assembling machine again with the newly smelted iron plate.
craft_item(Prototype.AssemblingMachine1, quantity=1)

# Finally, check the inventory after crafting the assembling machine.
print(f"Inventory after crafting assembling machine: {inspect_inventory()}")
